summary_of_threads_started_this_week:
A meeting is set to discuss BIP 119's activation parameters, urging participants to prep with related pull requests and past meeting records, aiming for a productive dialogue on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List group [source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALiT-Zqo-gRCeMDd2VtmXL7Ox31OT3pFmsfXQ5mq6SzeuFnMzg@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#me7eb4a1d593c073163e2163e717798c4a62d8a8e). Defenwycke's DustSweep proposal introduces a solution for reducing Bitcoin's UTXO set by proposing a transaction category to consolidate uneconomical dust, with its draft for public review on GitHub [here](https://github.com/defenwycke/bip-dust-sweep). The exploration of hash-based post-quantum cryptographic solutions highlights their potential for Bitcoin, focusing on schemes like SPHINCS+ for their robustness against quantum attacks, with detailed insights provided in a report and supporting scripts available [here](https://eprint.iacr.org/2025/2203) and [here](https://github.com/BlockstreamResearch/SPHINCS-Parameters).

A soft fork proposal addresses the Bitcoin timestamp overflow issue, suggesting a method to extend functionality without a system overhaul, relying on miner and node compliance with new rules, detailed further on [Bitcoin Stack Exchange](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/75831/what-is-time-warp-attack-and-how-does-it-work-in-general/7583475834). Victor introduces a non-custodial vault system, seeking feedback on using pruned nodes within Bitcoin's PSBT workflows for efficient UTXO management, aiming for a robust solution without custodial risks. Lastly, the Bitcoin and Ethereum ecosystems see a potential bridge via SatsBridge's protocol, integrating Lightning Network with Ethereum smart contracts to enhance cross-chain wallet security and user experience, with an invitation for community engagement on their [Telegram group](https://t.me/SatsBridge).

new_threads_this_week.title: CTV activation meeting on IRC - Thursday 18 December 17:00 UTC
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- A meeting on BIP 119 activation parameters is scheduled for next week.
- Participants should review related requests, methods, and logs before joining.
- The agenda features discussing activation parameters and constructing an activation client.

new_threads_this_week.title: Draft BIP: DustSweep – policy-only UTXO dust compaction
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The DustSweep proposal by Defenwycke targets long-term dust accumulation in the UTXO set.
- It introduces transactions with specific features and conditions for clearing "dust-class" UTXOs efficiently.
- Defenwycke seeks feedback on the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal draft available on GitHub for public review.

new_threads_this_week.title: Hash-Based Signatures for Bitcoin's Post-Quantum Future
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Hash-based cryptographic solutions are gaining attention for Bitcoin's quantum resistance.
- Optimizations can reduce signature sizes, enhancing practicality without compromising security.
- The Bitcoin community is encouraged to discuss the integration of these post-quantum solutions.

new_threads_this_week.title: Does GCC preclude a soft fork to handle timestamp overflow?
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- A soft fork aims to fix the Bitcoin timestamp overflow bug using a "timewarp attack." - It involves miners adjusting timestamps in blocks to prevent halts without a system overhaul.
- This method, avoiding a hard fork, faces complexities and security concerns requiring further analysis.

new_threads_this_week.title: Re: The Cat, BIP draft discussion.
authors: The Cat, BIP draft discussion Bitcoin Mechanic
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The email discusses the impact of spam mitigation strategies like "The Cat" on Bitcoin.
- Critics argue such techniques may contradict Bitcoin's foundational principles, while others see efficiency gains.
- The author suggests cautious acceptance of "The Cat," emphasizing the need for consensus and careful implementation.

new_threads_this_week.title: Feedback on a simple 2-path vault design (2-of-2 + CLTV recovery) and use of pruned nodes for UTXO retrieval
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Victor is developing a non-custodial vault with two spending paths for security.
- He questions the use of pruned nodes for managing UTXOs and PSBTs in Bitcoin.
- Victor seeks feedback on vault safety, script design, and potential Taproot improvements.

new_threads_this_week.title: [Discussion] Year 2106 Timestamp Overflow - Proposal for uint64 Migration
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Bitcoin faces a timestamp overflow issue in 2106 due to its 32-bit system.
- A hard fork to a 64-bit integer system is proposed to prevent operational failures.
- Community action is essential now to ensure a smooth, non-disruptive transition.

new_threads_this_week.title: Request for early peer review of two BIP drafts (BUDS and segOP)
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The email introduces two Bitcoin Improvement Proposals for peer review.
- BUDS aims to improve Bitcoin transaction data description without affecting consensus.
- segOP proposes a structured method for embedding data in Bitcoin transactions for efficiency.

new_threads_this_week.title: Proposal: Limit ScriptPubKey length, with one exception
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The proposal suggests a 260-byte limit on ScriptPubKey for UTXO transactions with one exception.
- This exception applies to transactions in every 256th block, aimed at flexibility and data loss prevention.
- The limitation seeks to optimize encoding efficiency and minimize overhead, inviting feedback for future refinement.

new_threads_this_week.title: Scheduled (Delayed) Transaction Broadcast
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Scheduled transaction broadcast in Bitcoin Core explores allowing future-timed transaction broadcasts.
- It proposes storing transactions for future broadcast, introducing a new RPC but not guaranteeing delivery.
- The concept is in the prototype stage, seeking community feedback to identify issues and enhance utility.

new_threads_this_week.title: SHRINCS: 324-byte stateful post-quantum signatures with static backups
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- SHRINCS combines stateful hash-based and stateless signature schemes for limited signature scenarios.
- It uses an unbalanced XMSS tree and SPHINCS+ variant, ensuring efficiency and robust fallback.
- Transition to stateless mode secures SHRINCS against state mismanagement, maintaining integrity.

new_threads_this_week.title: Writing version 2 of my Bitcoin Game Theory book with de Gruyter, what should I cover?
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The book updating process is seeking input for content improvement and relevance.
- Readers are invited to review the book's contents online via the publisher's link.
- Feedback is crucial for identifying necessary updates and maintaining the book's usefulness.

new_threads_this_week.title: Bitcoin Lightning Wallets as Abstracted Accounts in EVM Protocols
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- SatsBridge introduces a protocol bridging Bitcoin's LN and Ethereum's smart contracts, enhancing security and user experience.
- The protocol allows Lightning wallets to act as remote signers for Ethereum accounts, using cryptographic compatibility.
- It addresses risks like blind signing by proposing a Web3 app and potential Metamask integration for improved security.

active_posts_this_week.title: Motion to Activate BIP 3
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Murch proposes to revert AI/LLM guidelines in Bitcoin Improvement Proposals due to community feedback.
- A new Changelog for BIPs aims to enhance documentation and transparency.
- Future AI/LLM guidance in BIPs is postponed, prioritizing current initiatives.

active_posts_this_week.title: A safe way to remove objectionable content from the blockchain
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Peter highlights a flaw in Bitcoin's HTLCs using ZKP, risking transaction security.
- Boris warns ZKP reliance may limit data access, threatening network self-sovereignty.
- To safeguard Bitcoin's openness, Boris urges integrating data availability in ZKP designs.

active_posts_this_week.title: [BIP Proposal] Add sp() output descriptor format for BIP352
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- An approach to improve Bitcoin descriptors for scanning was discussed, suggesting a birthday inclusion.
- The consensus favors existing key formats for silent payments, avoiding new key complexities.
- A proposal for encoding multiple BIP352 labels within a 64-bit number was introduced for efficiency.

active_posts_this_week.title: Reducing RAM requirements with dynamic dust
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Erik Aronesty addressed Bitcoin Core skepticism in a developer forum.
- He confirmed the issue does not affect Libbitcoin, indicating its robustness.
- This distinction upholds the integrity and reliability of the Bitcoin protocol.

active_posts_this_week.title: Splitting more block, addr and tx classes of network traffic
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Defenwycke critiques explicit signalling in P2P networks, suggesting a class-based model for security.
- The email proposes adding randomness to relay behaviors to prevent topology inference attacks.
- It advocates for integrating traffic management within a single connection to improve efficiency and security.

active_posts_this_week.title: Dust Expiry: Clean the UTXO set from spam
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The proposal targets non-monetary Bitcoin dust to reduce spam and clutter.
- Approximately 40% of Bitcoin Core's UTXO set is spam, identified under specific rules.
- It suggests shifting responsibility to users, blending regulatory savvy with spam reduction efforts.

active_posts_this_week.title: Benchmarking Bitcoin Script Evaluation for the Varops Budget (Great Script Restoration)
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new Bitcoin sigversion that works alongside current ones without altering them.
- It aims to ensure the new sigversion, using Generalized Schnorr Signatures, doesn’t compromise script performance.
- Discussion shifts towards revising varops budget for existing sigversions, highlighting the complexity of script changes.

active_posts_this_week.title: Bitcoin Embracing MimbleWimble
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Atomic swaps allow cryptocurrency exchange without intermediaries but face miner censorship issues.
- Strategies to bypass censorship include using privacy technologies, splitting transactions, and engaging with private mining pools.
- Decentralized exchanges provide a censorship-resistant platform for executing atomic swaps.

active_posts_this_week.title: Non-confiscatory Transaction Weight Limit
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The debate focuses on managing blockchain transactions, especially on size and block stuffing issues.
- A new proposal suggests consensus rules for transaction sizes and block space optimization.
- Strategies for mempool management and mining aim to enhance transaction efficiency and network health.

active_posts_this_week.title: Building a vault using blinded co-signers
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The email discusses enhancing blockchain transactions with sophisticated Zero-Knowledge proofs.
- It proposes a method using a taproot address for secure and validated spending.
- Suggests establishing a reputation system for co-signers to improve transaction integrity.

active_posts_this_week.title: BIP The Cat - Draft discussion
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The NACK concept introduces consensus-level UTXO confiscation in digital currencies.
- It could change trust, security, and autonomy in blockchain, moving towards centralized control.
- This raises debates on balancing regulation with blockchain's decentralized ethos.
